name: Meta Common Bond 2 Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
toilet&toilets.

	A toilet (which is found in a restroom) has a tank, and "toilet water" is an unappetizing name for a type of cologne.

airplane&airplanes.

	"Jefferson Airplane" was a 60's musical group. Airplanes have both pilots and wings.

news.

	Newport News is a city in Virginia. "Daily news" is a common saying, as is "all the news that's fit to print."

origami.

	Origami is the Japanese art of folding models from paper, such as flapping birds and cranes.

cut.

	"The unkindest cut" and "cut rate" are popular expressions. A cut is also a laceration.

money.

	"Funny money" and "spending money" are popular terms, and money is currency.

white.

	"Snow White," egg white and whitewash are all common terms using this color's name.

book&books.

	The "Good Book" is a common term for the Bible. A bookbinder puts books together, and a book has pages.

school&schools.

	All of these can be found in a school!

questions.text: What do all of the above answers have in common?
questions.explanation:
paper.

	Toilet paper (q. 1), newspaper (q. 3) and origami paper (q. 4) are all types of paper. Paper airplanes (q. 2) are made of paper, as are books (q. 8) and money (q. 6.) When we think of paper, we usually think of white (q. 7.) Paper is found in schools (q. 9)If you are not careful with your paper, you'll get a paper cut! (q. 5)
